file_content.text: Hey, there. Mind telling me what you're doing in my hideout?
How did you find me so quickly?
This is unexpected.
A silent alarm linked to my holocommunicator. Who says it doesn't pay to be paranoid?
I just wandered in here by mistake.
Who? Me?
Do I look like I was born in the Outer Rim? Don't answer that.
Hey, yourself.
The guy who owns that crate of eels you're about to destroy.
I don't answer to you.
I think it is. You just put a bunch of holes in my employees.
Nice bomb there. I'm guessing you don't realize who I am. You're in over your head, chum.
My name's Nokril. I work for the Empire, securing valuable resources by whatever means necessary.
I thought the Empire hated smugglers.
You're a criminal.
A common misconception. The Empire only hates smugglers who don't work for them.
I'm going to rest my eyes during this thrilling monologue.
I'm already bored.
I admire a sense of humor in tense situations. You should hang onto that.
So?
Hey, we're not all scary Sith and creepy Moffs. Most of us are just earning a living.
I'm here because the Empire discovered how to process spice into painkillers. Save sick and injured soldiers when there's not enough kolto around.
The Empire's never been in the spice trade before, but there are young men and women who need these painkillers. You see the predicament?
Of course. I... let's just say I share similar sympathies.
Better than you think.
Then help me secure this shipment.
I could use some combat-grade painkillers.
Healing meds are useful.
Couldn't we all? Unfortunately, I'm not carrying any samples.
Of course.
In an ideal galaxy, we'd just steal the stuff, but the Empire wants to play nice with the Hutts.
Don't try to sound noble.
Enough for me to make you a very generous offer to leave those eels alone.
The Empire needs Nem'ro's spice to save lives. How about you dump that electromagnetic pulse-bomb through the sewer grate next to you?
Then, tell me who hired you. I won't kill the guy, just explain things. When I'm done, you make a lot of credits. Deal?
You'll have to get your spice someplace else.
No way. [Leave the bomb as is]
The Empire's gonna kill me when they find out this deal got blown.
You'd better hope we never meet again, chum.
My employer's name is Getzo. He's in Nem'ro's palace.
Absolutely. [Dump the bomb]
That shifty little womp rat? I knew he was trouble.
Head back to the palace and talk to Getzo, chum. We'll settle this business there.
